About organising events

You need permission from Gloucester City Council to hold events on council-owned land or property. This includes parks, open spaces, and council buildings.

We help you plan safe events that work for everyone. Our team will guide you through what you need to do.

Who can organise events

Anyone can apply to organise an event, including:

  • Community groups and charities
  • Businesses and commercial organisers
  • Individuals planning celebrations

How long it takes

You must apply well in advance. The time needed depends on the size of your event:

  • Small events (up to 499 people) ‚Äì apply at least 3 months before
  • Medium events (500-2999 people) ‚Äì apply 3-6 months before
  • Large events (3000 or more people) ‚Äì apply at least 6 months before
  • Street parties ‚Äì apply 6-8 weeks before

Popular venues

  • Gloucester Park
    Premier city park with 11 hectares of space
  • Hillfield Gardens
    Community park suitable for smaller events
  • Barnwood Park & Arboretum
    Green space with varied facilities
  • Plock Court & Oxstalls Sports Park
    Sports facilities and outdoor space
  • Gloucester Guildhall
    Historic building for performances and ceremonies

Check if your venue is available
